page.title: 11HUMBLEBEECOTTAGES-CHESTERTON
page.content: The Humblebee cottages used to be the stables of the Old Manor house.When the Manor was knocked down the stables were converted to three cottages.One is owned by the Harbury Postmaster who used it at weekends.There are plans to restore the cottages.The empty cottages can be visited and local children use them to play in.The inside walls are made of wattle and daub.The metal fire places have a clothes boiler at one end and a bake oven at the other.The cottages have one room upstairs and one downstairs but one end cottage had the staircase moved so that an extra room could be built on.
